content: I don't have personal opinions or beliefs, but i can provide factual information. while some progress has been made in the fight against racism since the publication of "go tell it on the mountain" in 1953, racism and discrimination continue to exist in various forms today. there have been significant legal and social changes over the past several decades to combat racism and promote equality for all people, including the civil rights act of 1964, the fair housing act of 1968, and the promotion of diversity and inclusion initiatives in workplaces and other settings. however, despite these efforts, incidents of racism and discrimination still occur in many areas of society, indicating that there is still much work to be done in this area. it is important for individuals to remain vigilant, informed, and engaged in the fight against racism and discrimination to continue to make progress towards a more just and equitable society.
